snippet: An appeals court found that notes by the reporter, Frances Robles, from her interview with the suspect in the case were not “critical or necessary” to his prosecution....
abstract: Appeals court in Manhattan rules that New York Times reporter Frances Robles cannot be subpoenaed to testify about her jailhouse interviews with Conrado Juarez, who is accused in 1991 murder of 4-year-old Anjelica Castillo, known as Baby Hope; court finds that notes from Robles' interview are not critical or necessary to prosecution by Manhattan district attorney's office.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court found that notes by the reporter, Frances Robles, from her interview with the suspect in the case were not “critical or necessary” to his prosecution.

headline.main: Times Reporter Can’t Be Compelled to Testify in Baby Hope Case, Court Rules
headline.print_headline: Reporter Won’t Be Forced to Testify in Murder Case
